text: I write this with no knowledge of my immediate fate. These words may be my last.

When I step into that submersible with my colleague tomorrow, I am putting my life in the hands of both my father, the designer of this fair vessel, and the wilds of the deep. I have nothing but trust and respect for the former -- the latter being the source of my apprehension.
Our search is ultimately for nothing -- a journey of pure speculation.

My colleague is a young man of buoyant enthusiasm and great potential. His fervour is contagious, and his presence is of undeniable comfort to me. Tomorrow we will enter that module, reinforced against the most foreign elements, and have the door shut and locked behind us.
Then, all we can do is wait and see where the ballast takes us.
